title: Use the Commutative Property
text: Group like variables together. The commutative property states that multiplication is reversible, so rearranging the variables has no effect on the answer.

title: Add
text: Add the exponents for each variable together using the Product Property.

title: Take Reciprocals
text: Since the exponents are negative, simplify by taking the reciprocal of the variables and making the exponent positive. This will be $$\frac{1}{m} \frac{1}{n^5}$$.
